title: Samsung i847 Rugby Smart
text:
The Samsung Rugby Smart (SGH-i847) was a ruggedized <a href="Android%20%28operating%20system%29">Android</a> smartphone manufactured by <a href="Samsung">Samsung</a>, for use on the <a href="AT%26amp%3BT%20Mobility">AT&T Mobility</a> network. The phone was <a href="3.5G">3.5G</a> capable, but lacked <a href="LTE%20%28telecommunication%29">LTE</a> support. It was dust and vibration resistant, as well as waterproof to a depth of for 30 minutes, earning the phone an <a href="IP%20Code">ingress protection rating</a> of IP67.
Reception.
The Samsung Rugby Smart was rated 4 stars out of 5 by "<a href="PC%20Magazine">PC Magazine</a>" and selected as their Editors' Choice. Phone Arena scored it 7½ out of 10. <a href="CNET">CNET</a> rated the smartphone 3½ stars out of 5.
Samsung Galaxy Rugby Pro.
In October 2012, Samsung and AT&T announced the <a href="Samsung%20Galaxy">Samsung Galaxy</a> Rugby Pro (SGH-i547), a successor to the Rugby Smart that includes similar durability and also ships with a scratch-resistant screen, something its previous model lacked. This rugged smartphone has passed military specification tests, like surviving blowing rain and sand, high humidity, and thermal shock. It comes with the push-to-talk features, but has LTE capability and a faster 1.5 GHz processor running Android 4.0 ICS.
